messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Cultural literacy,cultural lies and mainstream  society
messages.msgSnippet: ... the ... I haven t seen the movie, but we re experiencing similar fallout from government decisions a couple of generations ago here in BC. Tia They that
messages.messageBody:
> I would agree with that. It was horrifying to watch really. Listening to
the
> government officials outlining their plan to phase an entire race out of
> existence.
> I thought as I watched it that it was so like Hitler and his plan for
> Germany. How did they not see it?
> I live in a small country town in australia and we have such huge racial
> problems in the town. I don't see them ever being solved, just getting
> worse.
> Somethings are so bad that they can't ever be fixed and taking a whole
> generation away from their families is one of them.

I haven't seen the movie, but we're experiencing similar fallout from
government decisions a couple of generations ago here in BC.
Tia

"They that can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary
saftety deserve neither liberty nor safety." Ben Franklin
